episode_title: 622 - The One Where Paul’s The Man

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel, Chandler, Monica, and Joey are there as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi, you guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well it’s just—it’s one of those situations that I just hate. Y’know? A massage client gave me three tickets to the Helmet-Pelts exhibit at the Morgan Chase museum.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now you’re thinking you gotta sleep with him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! No! It’s just that he gave me three tickets and there are six of us!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll give up my ticket.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay that’s so generous!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And I think Ross is generous too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Great! Okay then it’s just us girls!

content.speaker: Monica and Rachel
content.text: Great.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So what-what is the exhibit.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s mostly just photographs of lesbian love scenes interspersed with video games and free sandwiches.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh man! (Hits Chandler)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Ross listen Chandler got you out of going to the lesbian sandwich museum this weekend!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks? But I have plans; Elizabeth and I are going out of town.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh that’s great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I mean think about all the money that you’re gonna make!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why? What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, her father pays you for baby-sitting right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, that’s funny. But maybe it’s time to move on, let it go, y’know? Stop it! Besides, Rachel is going out with Elizabeth’s father, so ah, he’s much older than she is. Looks like I’m not the only one interested in fossils, huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean Ross all that does is remind us that you are interested in fossils.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay. Uh, well uh, Rachel is going to need to yell sweet nothings (Paul enters) in his ear.

(And walks up right behind Ross, and standard sitcom joke 2B follows with the person being insulted standing right behind the person doing the insulting while the rest of the people become frightened and try to warn the insulter about the insultee’s presence.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, come on you guys; that’s funny! Y’know? Because he’s need—he’s got like a hearing aide y’know, ‘cause-‘cause y’know, ‘cause he’s all old, and…

(Paul reveals his presence by laughing, thus concluding standard sitcom joke 2B. Paul then pulls Ross aside to have a little chat with him and tells the rest of the group that he’ll just be one second.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Okay look, Ross, just so you know that since Lizzie likes you so much, I’ve decided to accept the fact that you’re going out with her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really? That okay, that’s great.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Yeah. But then I changed my mind. I’m funny like that. So I told Lizzie, now I’m telling you, I don’t want you seeing my daughter anymore.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right look, I-I realize it upsets you.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Yes it does.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But, Elizabeth and I are-are both adults and so I don’t think there’s really anything you can do about it.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I’ll call the university and tell them about your relationship and have you fired.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh! A man with a plan!

content.description: A Dry Cleaners, Joey is there with Phoebe and is trying to get his picture put back amongst the other celebrities hanging on the walls.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, this is so exciting! You get your picture back up on the wall of fame! Eek!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know. It was so cool when I was up there before. Me and Jim Belushi would just be crackin’ up about something… Then I get fired off of Days Of Our Lives and he takes me down. Now he’s just laughing at me. Look at him, that smug Belushi bastard, I’ll…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, okay maybe they put your picture back up they can put you next to Matt Lauer. Look at him, smiling at me. (Giggles) Yeah I know; we’d be great together!
(The dry cleaner finishes with the customer in front of Joey and they approach the counter.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! So I’m back.

content.speaker: The Dry Cleaner
content.text: Who are you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Joey Tribbiani! From the wall! (The dry cleaner doesn’t remember) Okay, maybe this will jog your memory, huh? (Holds his picture up in front of his face.) Huh? Okay eh-ah-anyway, I’m ready to go back up on the wall I’m the star of a new TV show.

content.speaker: The Dry Cleaner
content.text: Show me in the table.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh well, it’s not on TV yet.

content.speaker: The Dry Cleaner
content.text: Well, then it’s not on the wall yet.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, fine, I will bring you a tape, huh? (Walks away)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So umm, now do you have any of Matt Lauer’s clothes here? Maybe? Just ones that haven’t been cleaned yet?
(The dry cleaner just stares at her and she retreats.)

content.description: The Morgan Chase Museum, the girls are entering.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I love museums!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Soakin’ up all the culture.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Where do you want to start?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, the gift shop!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, and then lunch.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, wait yes, but I can’t eat too much. Paul is taking me out to dinner tonight, he said he has a big surprise planned.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh wow. What, do you think maybe he’s gonna tell you that he’s gay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! No! Why?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No reason! That would just be a really big surprise, right?
(A museum official enters with another man and woman.)

content.speaker: The Museum Official
content.text: You can put the aisle over here (points), and put the wedding ceremony right over here. (Points.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I didn’t know you could get married here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This would be a beautiful place to get married, yeah, but I wouldn’t put the aisle there and I would never have the ceremony there! (Points to both places.) I mean you’d have the ceremony under this big beautiful arch. (The arch at the entrance to the room.)

content.speaker: The Museum Official
content.text: May I help you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh sorry didn’t mean to interrupt. It’s just such a beautiful space; do you do a lot of weddings here?

content.speaker: The Museum Official
content.text: Yes. We’re very popular. There’s a two-year waiting list. Sorry! (She kinda storms out with the couple.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, you should totally put your name down on the list

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! Are you crazy?! I’m not getting married! I’m not even engaged.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but there’s a two-year wait. And then what if you get engaged in two years and then you got to wait another two years for this place. That’s four years. Chandler’s not gonna wait that long. He’s gonna find somebody else, y’know? Someone, someone who did put their name on the list. (Rachel agrees.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah hon, it can’t hurt to put your name down! I mean in if two years if you’re not engaged you just don’t use it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I mean I guess there is no harm in putting my name down.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m gonna do it too!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Me too!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really? Who would, who would you marry?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know, I don’t have anyone right now. Y’know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Pheebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Don’t feel too sorry for me. At least my boyfriend isn’t gay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, that stuff is…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Don’t even get me started on yours!

content.description: The Dry Cleaners, Joey is trying to get his picture up again.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! So, did you watch the tape of my show?

content.speaker: The Dry Cleaner
content.text: I did.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, let’s get me back up there! (Holds out his picture.)

content.speaker: The Dry Cleaner
content.text: No! It don’t go up on the wall!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What—But you saw the show!

content.speaker: The Dry Cleaner
content.text: Yes, it was very offensive to my people!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dry cleaners?

content.speaker: The Dry Cleaner
content.text: Russians! It showed them as terrorists and villains!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay! Okay, look! You-you-you got Harrison Ford up there!

content.speaker: The Dry Cleaner
content.text: That’s right. Mr. Ford is a very good customer, he brings us a lot of clothes; you bring us nothing!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay well that may be true. But, in-in okay, Air Force One the Russians were terrorists! And evil! And plus he kills a bunch of them! That-that-that’s offensive to Russians.

content.speaker: The Dry Cleaner
content.text: I’ve never seen it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh you should, it’s great.
(The Dry Cleaner stares at him and Joey retreats.)

content.description: A Cabin in the Woods, Elizabeth is giving Ross a tour.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This place is really beautiful!

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Yeah, I’ve been coming here since I was a kid. This used to be my Grandma’s.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! The only thing I got from my Grandmother was her eyes. I mean not-not her actual eyeballs, but, but people say that my eyes—Do-do you want to make out?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Sure!
(They fall to the couch and start to make out, but Ross stops suddenly.)

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Are you okay? What’s wrong?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ehh, I was just, I was just thinking about your father.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Well, whatever works for ya…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. No-no uh, he just, he just really freaked me out before.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Oh. Well, so we have to hide our relationship from one more person. Big deal. Besides, it’s kinda fun hiding.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.
(They start making out again.)

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Hey umm, you brought protection right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why?! Are there like bears or something?! (Looks around and then sees that Elizabeth is shaking her head no and realizes what Elizabeth meant.) Ohh. Oh, protection. Yeah-no, yeah-no, that-that-that I forgot.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: I’ll just run to the store and get some.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no! Hey-hey, I’m the guy! I’ll get it.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Do you know where the store is?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Do you want to ride around town on my little pink bicycle?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A little bit.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: I’ll be back in ten minutes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Why don’t you get in the hot tub and I’ll meet you there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh, okay.
(Elizabeth leaves and Ross starts to remove his clothing right there in the middle of the living room where someone can see him. Of course, someone almost does, but he hears a door opening and…)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, what a great surprise! This is such a beautiful house.
(Ross with his pants around his ankles tries to run, but Dr. Geller forgets that he has his pants around his ankles and falls down trying to flee.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Thank you, it’s my mom’s. So this is the kitchen.

(Dr. Geller, the man with the Ph.D. in Paleontology, is trying to find a place to hide, but this supposedly intelligent man in the hands of clich�d scriptwriters runs around with his pants down around his ankles like one of the Three Stooges.)

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler is reading the newspaper as the phone rings. He let’s the machine answer it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’ve reached Monica and Chandler’s, if you’re listening to this message, we’re probably screening. (to himself) Yeah we are.

content.speaker: The Museum Official
content.text: Hi, this is Heldi from the Morgan Chase museum. I’m calling for Monica Geller. I want to let her know that there was a cancellation and if she’s still interested in having the Bing-Geller wedding at our facility, it is available… (Chandler runs to answer the phone.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is Chandler Bing! This is Chandler Bing! (Listens) Yes, the groom—No! Not the groom!!

content.description: Paul’s Cabin, Paul and Rachel are sitting on the couch drinking wine and talking.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s so secluded up here.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I know. I like it up here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I feel like we’re the only two people in the world. (She sets down her wine class, picks up a walnut, and knocks another one on the floor.) Oops. Sorry. (She reaches down to pick it up and Ross hands it to her. Ross is hiding under the couch and causes Rachel to scream.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: What’s the matter honey? Did you see a little mouse?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no! Big bear! Big bear outside! I think I-I—would you—actually, would you go check on that?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Honey, we don’t have any bears here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, okay. Would-would you get me a Diet Coke ?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Okay. I’ll be right back. (Gets up and heads for the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (After Paul leaves Rachel drops to the floor to confront Ross.) What?! What are you doing here?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you doing here?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I came with Paul!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I recognize the ankles!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Get up!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Here you go honey! (Rachel kicks Ross back under the couch.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahh. Thank you!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Diet Coke . (Hands her the glass.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Op, ice. I need ice.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I’ll be right back. (He goes to get the ice.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You and your ice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh! Get out! Get out! Go! Come on! (Ross gets up and heads for the kitchen.) No! Not in there! He’s in there! (She points Ross to the door next to the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Did you really hear a bear?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Go-go!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Here you go honey. One Diet Coke with ice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, thank you.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I’m so happy that you’re here.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Here I am!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Elizabeth! Oh look, Elizabeth’s here! Who are you talking to?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Uh, you guys?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: How did you know we were here?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Umm…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, she-she ob-obviously saw the tire tracks that were leading up to the closed garage.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Obviously.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Elizabeth, what are you doing here?! (Motions that he brought Rachel here to be alone with her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did-did you come up here to work on that term paper or something?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Yeah! Yep.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, why do y’know go in that room (points to the room Ross is in) and do your homework?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Ohh, I wouldn’t do it in there. That’s my dad’s bedroom.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s your, that’s your dad’s bedroom. (Yelling) That’s your dad’s bedroom!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Why are you yelling?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa, that Diet Coke just went straight to my head! Woo!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler is sitting at the kitchen table staring at the phone as Monica enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, honey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See you later. (Starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? I-I bought groceries, I was gonna make you dinner!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well next time ask! Or at least wait for me to ask! (He storms out.)
(Monica puts the groceries down and goes to check the answering machine and hears.)

content.speaker: The Museum Official
content.text: Hi, this is Heldi from the Morgan Chase museum. I’m calling for Monica Geller.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no!

content.speaker: The Museum Official
content.text: I want to let her know that there was a cancellation and if she’s still interested in having the Bing-Geller wedding at our facility, it is available…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh please, he didn’t hear it! He didn’t hear it!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is Chandler Bing! This is Chandler Bing! (The machine beeps off.)

content.description: The Dry Cleaner’s, Joey has brought in a bunch of laundry in another attempt to get his picture on the wall, but the dry cleaner isn’t working right now. Instead, a beautiful woman is working.

content.speaker: Female Clerk
content.text: Can I help you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh yeah, where-where’s the guy who decides who’s pictures go up on the wall?

content.speaker: Female Clerk
content.text: He’s not here right now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you’re kidding me! All-all right, well make sure you tell him that Joey Tribbiani stopped by to drop off all of these clothes. Okay? I’m an actor; I’m kinda getting my picture up there on the wall.

content.speaker: Female Clerk
content.text: Y’know, there are two people who could put your picture up there. (She makes eyes at him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh really? Well, maybe you and I go out for drinks? (Pause) You’re the other one right? (She thinks about it for a second and nods yes.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: So Lizzie, are-are-are you planning on staying the night?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Oh no-no believe me, I’m leaving as soon as possible!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Good. Good. Not that we don’t want you to stay, obviously you’re welcome—How much more homework do you have?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Ahh, I just have one problem left that I do not know how to solve. Uhh, Rachel maybe you want to come upstairs and help me figure it out?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really? Okay. Okay, I-I’ll go upstairs. (to Paul) If-if you get me something from the car.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: What do you need from the car?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Surprise me.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Okay. (Starts for the car.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So you’re gonna be in the car, I will be upstairs, and that’s where everybody’s gonna be!
(Rachel and Elizabeth go upstairs. Paul starts for the car, but notices his luggage is still out and decides to take in into the bedroom.)
[Cut to his bedroom, Ross is listening at the door as Paul opens the door, trapping Ross behind it. With Paul’s back turned Ross coils up like a snake and slitters underneath the bed.]

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Just relax. Just relax Paul, you’re doing great. (Ross moves a piece of luggage over so he can watch Paul.) She likes you. She… Maybe, she likes you. She likes you. Y’know why? Because you’re a (pause) neat guy. (Ross can’t believe what he’s hearing.) You are the man. You are (pause) the man! (He opens his shirt and looks at his chest.) I still got it. Nice and sexy. You’re just a love machine. (Starts singing) I’m just a love machine and I won’t work for nobody but you! Hey bab-y! (Flexes and grunts loudly.) Showtime. (Starts to leave and starts singing.) I’m just a love machine, yeah ba-by! (Grunts again and Ross is stunned.)
content.parenthetical: standing in front of a mirror and to himself

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is there as Monica rushes in.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Have you seen Chandler?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! Why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The woman from the museum called and said that there was a cancellation and that we could move up our wedding and Chandler heard! (Phoebe gasps.) I know! How bad is this?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well for the regular guy, it’s bad, but Chandler, Oh dear God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know! I know! And he totally freaked out and I can’t find him anywhere!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What are you gonna do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I’m never gonna listen to you again, that’s for sure! (Mimicking her.) “Y’know, harm can it do if you go and put your name down?”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel said that!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well Rachel’s not here! (Runs out.)

content.description: The Dry Cleaner’s, Joey and Phoebe are entering to see if his picture is on the wall.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Here it is! (Noticing it next to the door.) Ooh, Joey! Why did you sign it, “Son of a bitch?” (Son of a bitch is written across the entire picture.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I didn’t do that! Who would’ve done that?!

content.speaker: The Dry Cleaner
content.text: Son of a bitch!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, maybe ask this guy.

content.speaker: The Dry Cleaner
content.text: You, get out of my shop!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, what did he do?

content.speaker: The Dry Cleaner
content.text: He went out with my wife!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa, I-I—Hey! I did not go out with your wife! (The same woman from before enters.) Okay? I went out with her! (Points at her.)

content.speaker: The Dry Cleaner
content.text: That’s my wife!!! Get out! (Starts yelling at him in Russian, and I’m betting he’s not saying pleasant things about him.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, we should go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Ross? Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Elizabeth! (He opens one of the bed stands that he has curled himself up into.) Okay. Okay. (She helps him out.) I’m gonna go out this window. (Points to the window next to him.) I’ll meet you at the front door. Just tell them you’re going home, okay?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wait-wait-wait!! No! Don’t go in there! Don’t go in there! I need another soda!
(Ross frantically starts to open the window as Paul enters and traps him halfway out the window.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God Ross! What in heaven’s name are you doing here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And that is why we cannot see each other anymore.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Ross. You and I are going to have to have a little talk.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Daddy!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: You’re next!!

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Okay. I didn’t know he was here. (Runs over to Rachel.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Let me just see if I got this straight. I tell you to stay away from my daughter or I’ll have you fired. What you heard was, “Take my daughter, come up to my country house, and ruin my weekend with Rachel!”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, please-please Paul, just let me explain…

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: No, let me explain! Fired!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, fine! Fine! Have me fired! But uh, I want you to know that you and I are not all that different. I mean, I too am a neat guy. (Paul just looks at him.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And I too am just a love machine. (Hums a little bit and mimics Paul’s flexing.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Ross, let me show you where the guest room is.

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica is pacing, waiting for Chandler to return. Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m so sorry. Please, stop freaking out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not freaking out. Why would I be freaking out? A woman named Heldi called and said we were getting married, but that happens everyday. (Does one of those Chandler noises.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, we were at this beautiful place, and I-I-I just put our names down for fun! I mean, what’s the harm in that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right here! (Clucks like a chicken for some reason.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, please don’t think I was trying to pressure you. Phoebe and Rachel…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phoebe and Rachel! So the people that knew about our wedding before me were you, Phoebe and Rachel, Heldi, and apparently some band called Starlight Magic 7 who are available by the way!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It was a mistake. Please don’t take this to mean anything, because it doesn’t.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, if it really doesn’t mean anything, because you know that I’m just not ready…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know! I know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (They hug.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m gonna go tell Joey that (laughs) that you’re back. I was really worried about you. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, did she buy it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Totally.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So did Heldi show you the place?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, it’s beautiful.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe you’re gonna ask Monica to marry you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know.
(They hug.)

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is going up to the counter.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Gunther.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Hey! Take these cappuccinos to table 11 and that guy over there (points) wants the biscotti.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh uh, well I just came in for a cup of coffee to go.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Do you still work here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No, I quit a long time ago. (Pause) Did I forget to you that one? I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Oh that’s cool, I was gonna fire you anyway.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great! (Takes his coffee and leaves.)
